intro: Junellia selaginoides var. selaginoides, commonly known as the silverleaf junellia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and greenhouses.
